arm_group.description: The external facilitation is a one year multifaceted intervention, including support, guidance, practice audit and feedback, training targeted to a team of practitioners involving the unit manager, the nurses and diet aides at the nursing home. The facilitator is a researcher and dietician.

The outreach visit is a three hour lecture about the nutritional guidelines targeted to a team of practitioners including the unit manager, the nurses and diet aides at the nursing home. The trained person giving the lecture is a researcher and dietician.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to examine two implementation strategies (external facilitation and
      educational outreach visit) when introducing nutritional guidelines in the elderly care
      setting and to evaluate the results of the implementation by clinical outcome measures of
      the nursing home residents.

      The hypothesis is that the residents affected by the external facilitation strategy will
      stay stable in the measured clinical outcomes, while the residents influenced by the
      educational outreach visit will deteriorate during the implementation process.

clinical_study.brief_title: Implementation of Nutritional Guidelines and Effects in Nursing Home Residents
condition: Nutritional Outcome of Nursing Home Residents

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age of 65 or older

          -  nursing home resident

          -  persons who manage the examination methods (interviews and blood samples)

        Exclusion Criteria:

        - persons in terminal stage of life

intervention.intervention_name: A one year multifaceted implementation strategy
A three hour lecture about the guidelines

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcome in Nursing Home Residents After Implementation of Nutritional Guidelines

other_outcome.description: Blood samples are collected for analysis of vitamin D, albumin, CRP (C-reactive protein), insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-1), creatinine and cystatin C, which gives biochemical information on the nutritional status, inflammation activity and renal function.
Morbidity is assessed with Charlson Comorbidity Index (CCI).

primary_outcome.description: Nutritional status is assessed with the Mini Nutritional Assessment-Short Form tool

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Functional status is assessed with ADL (Activities in Daily Living) Barthel index.
Cognitive status is assessed with Short Portable Mental Status Questionnaire (SPMSQ).
Health-related Quality of Life is assessed with EQ-5D.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
